Cox, 21st November j9l*. ----(Repeated to Foreign and Minister at Tehran.) (Received 21st November, 11 a.m.)5289. My telegram 5200. General Officer Commanding-in-Ciiief's final reply which 1 quoted therein continued and concluded with the following observations : "If the occasion should arise and the situation becomes sufficiently serious to necessitate our interference, troops would be despatched as recently done." General Officer Commanding, Karun, does not recommend distribution of arms."I did not quote these statements for the reasons which follow in my next telegram, but as General Officer Commanding considers that they affect issue and should have been quoted, I do so now.
